example.eg: I'll call you tomorrow to see how you are.
example.egtrans: 我明天会给你打电话看看你情况怎样。

example.eg: Jim, your mom's calling you.
example.egtrans: 吉姆，你妈妈在叫你。

example.eg: He called the names on the list and we wrote them down.
example.egtrans: 他大声宣读列表上的名字，我们把名字记了下来。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 大声说出, 大声读出

example.eg: Call the next candidate, please.
example.egtrans: 请叫下一位候选人过来。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 召唤, 传唤, 请来

example.eg: If you don't want to write you can always call.
example.egtrans: 如果不想写信，你可以打电话。

example.eg: Wade was so loud that I could hear him calling even from far away.
example.egtrans: 韦德哭喊的声音太大了，以至于我老远就听得到。

example.eg: I received a call from my bank manager today.
example.egtrans: 今天我接到银行经理的电话。

example.eg: The baby's due in three weeks but we don't know what to call her.
example.egtrans: 宝宝还有三周就出生了，但我们还不知道该叫她什么。

example.eg: They heard a call outside the window.
example.egtrans: 他们听到窗外有人呼喊。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 呼喊, 呼叫, 叫声

example.eg: Joanna's call told us she was ready to go.
example.egtrans: 乔安娜发出的信号告诉我们她准备走了。

example.eg: The principal's call for action followed a number of problems at the school.
example.egtrans: 学校出现了许多问题后，校长站出来呼吁要有所作为。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 请求，要求，呼吁, 召唤，呼唤

example.eg: He felt the call to the priesthood after his visit to Lourdes.
example.egtrans: 他在朝拜卢尔德后，感受到神召唤他成为牧师。

example.eg: He received a call to appear before the High Court.
example.egtrans: 他收到传唤，要在高等法院出庭。

example.eg: You can hear the call of an owl from my bedroom.
example.egtrans: 从我的卧室能听到猫头鹰的叫声。

example.eg: The call of a wolf made him sit up in his tent.
example.egtrans: 狼的长啸声让他在帐篷中坐起。

example.eg: He blew his duck call and didn't have to wait long before one appeared.
example.egtrans: 他吹响哨子召唤鸭子，没过多久，一只鸭子便出现了。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 模仿（鸟、兽的）叫声的工具（如哨子）

example.eg: She only arrived fifteen minutes before the call time.
example.egtrans: 她只比彩排通知的时间早到了十五分钟。

example.eg: There's no call for tears. It was only a joke.
example.egtrans: 没必要流泪，这只是个玩笑。

example.eg: There's little call for typewriter repair these days.
example.egtrans: 现在打字机修理已经没有什么需求了。

dsense.name: call
dsense.guideword: (cards: demand to show hands) (扑克游戏)

example.eg: I made a call, and the other players had to reveal their cards.
example.egtrans: 我要求摊牌，其他玩家只好把自己的牌亮出来。

dsense.name: call
dsense.guideword: (poker: equal a bet) (德州扑克游戏)

example.eg: He made a call with an average hand but ended up winning the pot.
example.egtrans: 他拿到一手很一般的牌，却跟注，最后居然赢光了赌池里的所有赌注。

example.eg: Are you going to bid? It's your call.
example.egtrans: 你要叫牌吗？该你叫牌了。

example.eg: The player disagreed with the umpire's call.
example.egtrans: 那位运动员不服裁判判决。

example.eg: Buying calls is a popular strategy for investors.
example.egtrans: 对投资人来说，买入买权是一种很流行的投资策略。

example.eg: This is your final call for payment.
example.egtrans: 这是给你的最后一次催款通知。

example.eg: Canceling the event was a good call, given the weather.  Both these candidates would be perfect for the job, but we can only hire one of them; it's going to be a tough call.
example.egtrans: 考虑到天气状况，取消活动是正确的决定。

example.eg: The receptionist said I couldn't talk to the doctor right then, because she was out on a call.
example.egtrans: 接待员告诉我说，现在我不能和医生交谈，因为她出诊去了。

example.eg: I'll call tomorrow morning on the way to work.
example.egtrans: 我会在明早上班途中顺路拜访。

example.eg: It's my turn and I'm going to call.
example.egtrans: 轮到我了，我要叫牌。

dsense.name: call
dsense.guideword: (poker: equal a bet) (德州扑克游戏)

example.eg: Do you want to call or raise?
example.egtrans: 你想跟还是加？

example.eg: Is that an owl calling?
example.egtrans: 是猫头鹰在叫吗？

example.eg: They called upon her to find a solution to their problems.
example.egtrans: 他们要求她为他们的问题找出解决方案。

example.eg: Steve called to his wife to come and help him.
Would you like to be called in the morning?
The umpire called the ball out.
He called the grouse into the open.
The debt could be called at any moment.
How dare you call me a cheat!
I call it a scandal.
They've called a meeting for tomorrow morning.
The sea was calling him.
Union leaders called an end to the strike after two weeks.
The game was called due to the rain.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 中止, 暂停, 停止

example.eg: Let's call it three miles from here to there.

dsense.name: call [sth]⇒
dsense.guideword: (cards: demand to see a hand) (卡牌)

example.eg: After the third round, anyone may call the hand.

dsense.name: call [sth]
dsense.guideword: (poker: equal a bet) (德州扑克游戏)

example.eg: I'll call your ten and raise you ten.
In American pool, you have to call your shot before you play it.
example.egtrans: 在美国的台球比赛中，你必须在击球前报袋。

example.eg: The doctor was suddenly called away, so he is not in the office today.
The senator called for an investigation.  The judge's bailiff called for silence in the courtroom.
example.egtrans: 参议员要求展开调查。法官的法警要求大家在庭内肃静。

example.eg: The recipe calls for brown sugar, not white sugar.  The situation calls for a calm, deliberate response.
example.egtrans: 菜谱需要的是红糖粉而不是白砂糖。这种情况需要的是冷静、慎重。

example.eg: The forecast calls for clear skies and warm temperatures.
example.egtrans: 天气预报预测说天气暖和，晴朗无云。

dsense.name: call [sb] in
dsense.guideword: (contact: a professional for help) (指专业工作人员)

example.eg: The tap was leaking, so Jess called in a plumber.
example.egtrans: 水龙头一直在漏水，杰西叫来了水管工。

example.eg: Grandma and Grandad called in today and we all had tea.
example.egtrans: 奶奶和爷爷今天都来了，我们一起喝了茶。

example.eg: Stef called in on her neighbour on the way to the shops, to ask if he needed anything.
example.egtrans: 斯黛弗在去商店的路上拜访了她的邻居，询问是否需要帮他带点什么。

example.eg: I just need to call in at the office on the way home to pick up some paperwork.
example.egtrans: 我只需要在回家的路上去趟办公室拿些文件。//我们去伦敦途中在布里斯托尔作了短暂停留。

example.eg: The bank called in Stuart's loan and he had to sell his house to repay it.
example.egtrans: 银行要求斯图尔特偿还贷款，他不得不卖掉房子来偿付。

dsense.name: call in, also UK: ring in, phone in

example.eg: Radio listeners are encouraged to call in to make comments.
example.egtrans: 我们鼓励电台听众打电话进来发表意见。

example.eg: The town's annual picnic was called off due to rain.
example.egtrans: 由于下雨，小镇一年一度的野餐活动被取消了。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 取消, 停止, 宣告终止

example.eg: John called on his friends for support.
example.egtrans: 约翰请他的朋友支持他。

example.eg: When you need help, then who can you call upon if not your friends?
example.egtrans: 当你需要帮助时，除了你的朋友还能找谁?

dsense.name: call on [sb] to do [sth], call upon [sb] to do [sth]

example.eg: The union called on the workers to support a strike.
example.egtrans: 工会号召工人支持罢工。

example.eg: John called on Mary while she was in the hospital.
example.egtrans: 玛丽住院时，约翰去看过她。

dsense.name: call on [sb]
dsense.guideword: US (teacher: pick a student to talk) (老师)

example.eg: The teacher called on me but I couldn't answer as I hadn't been listening.
example.egtrans: 老师让我回答问题，但是因为我没有在听讲，所以回答不出。

example.eg: The interviewer called the MP out when he spouted false statistics.
example.egtrans: 当议员虚报统计数据时，那位记者向他提出了质疑。

example.eg: Peter said that he would call round sometime this afternoon.
Let's call her up and check the plans.
example.egtrans: 我们打电话给她，确认一下计划。

example.eg: Conscripts were called up for military service according to their birthdates.
example.egtrans: 义务兵根据出生日期被征召入伍。

dsense.name: cry out for [sth], call out for [sth]

example.eg: The house was in poor condition and crying out for repair.

dsense.name: above and beyond the call of duty, beyond the call of duty

example.eg: He was honored for performing above and beyond the call of duty.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 超出职责范围, 超越工作要求

dsense.name: at [sb]'s beck and call, at the beck and call of [sb]
dsense.guideword: (available to serve you at any time)

example.eg: I will be at your beck and call.
I wasn't that into her but she was a good booty call.
Reveille is a famous bugle call that wakes up military personal at dawn.
The machine broke, so the foreman called a halt to the work.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 暂停, 停止, 制止

example.eg: Louise has never been afraid of calling a spade a spade.
This train will call at Bromley South and London King's Cross.
I'll call back when I can.
example.egtrans: 我方便的时候会回电话的。

example.eg: I'll call her back later.
example.egtrans: 我之后会给她回电话。

example.eg: Do they still have those red-and-glass telephone call boxes on the streets in London?
If you need technical support you can contact the call center.
Because he had no money, he called his parents collect.
Children love to call each other silly  names like Poopy-Head.
They've just published a call for papers for next year's conference.
It's time to call the children in for supper.
example.egtrans: 该叫孩子们进来吃晚饭了。

example.eg: He hosts a call-in show on the local radio station.
example.egtrans: 他在当地电台主持一个热线节目。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 邀请听众打电话进来的，听众热线的

dsense.name: call in sick, also UK: phone in sick, ring in sick
dsense.guideword: (notify employer you will be off sick)

dsense.name: call [sth] into question, call into question [sth]

example.eg: I've been working for hours, I'm going to call it a day.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 就此结束，收工，就干到这里

example.eg: I'm too tired to continue; I'm calling it quits.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 停止（做某事），叫停，就此打住

dsense.name: call letters
dsense.guideword: (TV, radio station: code) (无线电通讯时使用的代号)

example.eg: In school, Ralph was a bully and called me names.
The first sections of a call number represent the subject of a book.
Sirens wailed as the firefighters responded to the call of duty.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 使命所在, 职责所在

example.eg: Paul's elderly mother was unwell, so he called the doctor out.
example.egtrans: 保罗年迈的母亲感觉不适，所以他赶紧请来医生。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 紧急召集, 召唤出动

dsense.name: call [sb] out on [sth], call out [sb] on [sth]

example.eg: Julia called her uncle out on his offensive remarks.
example.egtrans: 茱莉亚斥责她叔叔的无礼言论。

example.eg: The teacher told the students to raise their hands if they knew the answer, rather than calling out.
The union has called its members out following the breakdown of talks with management.
We called her over to our table to join us.

dsense.name: call [sb] every name under the sun

example.eg: You can call me every name under the sun, but it doesn't change the situation one bit.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 用尽各种污言秽语辱骂某人
（电台、电视台的）呼号, 无线电传呼信号

example.eg: The teacher called the roll at the beginning of the class.

dsense.name: call the shots, call the tune

example.eg: The pastor may think he calls the shots, but the organist really leads the worship service.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 指挥, 操纵, 操纵
宣布打烊，宣布结束当日营业

example.eg: When I call time, you will put down your pencils and turn your exam papers over.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 宣布时间已到, 决定停止某事

example.eg: The vandalism was a call to action for the townspeople to band together.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 唤起行动, 行动号召

example.eg: Your story calls to mind the day I wore my evening gown to a staff meeting.
The company awarded a call-off contract to the supplier.
The firm placed a call-off order with the supplier.
The actress responded to call-outs on social media with an apology.
As an emergency plumber, Jason often had to attend call-outs at the weekends.
Emergency plumbers charge enormous call-out fees.
50,000 reserves got the call-up to join the campaign.
example.egtrans: 50,000后备人员受到征召参战。

example.eg: The player was thrilled to receive the call-up to play for his national team.
Someone from the insurance company called while you were out; I've written down their callback number here.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 演员面试会, 演员试镜会

example.eg: Phew! That was a close call. I thought he was going to ask to see my ID.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 侥幸逃脱, 死里逃生

example.eg: It was a close call, but they declared him the winner.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 难分胜负, 仲伯难分

example.eg: I got my start in sales by making door-to-door cold calls.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 电话推销, 上门推销

dsense.name: cold-call [sb]⇒
dsense.guideword: (make unsolicited sales visit or phone call)

example.eg: He cold-called all the people on his contact list.
The advantage of a conference call is that people from all over the world can take part.
Good afternoon Mrs Jones, this is just a courtesy call to let you know your car is now ready for collection.
Making a false distress call is a criminal act in many countries.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 明智的决策, 聪明的决定
